laazotea.indi.client

Class INDIServerConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • laazotea.indi.client.INDIServerConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    laazotea.indi.INDIProtocolParser

    public class INDIServerConnection
extends java.lang.Object
implements laazotea.indi.INDIProtocolParser
    A class representing a INDI Server Connection. Usually this is the entry point for any INDI Client to connect to the server, retrieve all devices and properties and so on.
    Version:
    1.32, January 27, 2013
    Author:
    S. Alonso (Zerjillo) [zerjioi at ugr.es]

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      INDIServerConnection(java.lang.String host)
      Constructs an instance of INDIServerConnection with no name and using the default port (7624).
      INDIServerConnection(java.lang.String host, int port)
      Constructs an instance of INDIServerConnection with no name.
      INDIServerConnection(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String host, int port)
      Constructs an instance of INDIServerConnection.

      • INDIServerConnection

        public INDIServerConnection(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.String host,
                    int port)
        Constructs an instance of INDIServerConnection. The Connection is NOT stablished.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the Connection.
        host - The host of the Connection.
        port - The port of the Connection.

        Parameters:

        port - The port of the Connection.

      • INDIServerConnection

        public INDIServerConnection(java.lang.String host)
        Constructs an instance of INDIServerConnection with no name and using the default port (7624). The Connection is NOT stablished.
        Parameters:
        host - The host of the Connection.

    • Method Detail

      • waitForDevice

        public INDIDevice waitForDevice(java.lang.String name)
        This function waits until a Device with a name exists in this Connection and returns it. The wait is dinamic, so it should be called from a different Thread or the app will freeze until the Device exists.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the evice to wait for.
        Returns:
        The Device once it exists in this Connection.

      • waitForDevice

        public INDIDevice waitForDevice(java.lang.String name,
                       int maxWait)
        This function waits until a Device with a name exists in this Connection and returns it. The wait is dinamic, so it should be called from a different Thread or the app will freeze until the Device exists or the maxWait number of seconds have elapsed.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the evice to wait for.
        maxWait - Maximum number of seconds to wait for the Device
        Returns:
        The Device once it exists in this Connection or null if the maximum wait is achieved.

      • setData

        public void setData(java.lang.String name,
           java.lang.String host,
           int port)
        Changes the name, host and port of the Connection if it is not connected.
        Parameters:
        name - The new name of the Connection.
        host - The new host of the Connection.
        port - The new port of the Connection.

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Connects to the INDI Server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is some problem connecting to the Server.

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        If connected, disconnects from the INDI Server and notifies the listeners.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected()
        Determines if the Connection is stablished of not.
        Returns:
        true if the Connection is stablished. false otherwise.

      • askForDevices

        public void askForDevices()
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the appropriate message to the INDI Server to be notified about the Devices of the Server.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is some problem with the Connection.

      • askForDevices

        public void askForDevices(java.lang.String device)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the appropriate message to the INDI Server to be notified about a particular Device of the Server.
        Parameters:
        device - the Device name that is asked for.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is some problem with the Connection.

      • askForDevices

        public void askForDevices(java.lang.String device,
                 java.lang.String propertyName)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Sends the appropriate message to the INDI Server to be notified about a particular Property of a particular Device of the Server.
        Parameters:
        device - the Device name of whose property is asked for.
        propertyName - the Property name that is asked for.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is some problem with the Connection.

                            throws java.io.IOException
        Sends a XML message to the server.
        Parameters:
        XML - the message to be sent.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is some problem with the Connection.

        public INDIDevice getDevice(java.lang.String name)
        Gets a particular Device by its name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Device
        Returns:
        the Device with the name or null if there is no Device with that name.

      • getProperty

        public INDIProperty getProperty(java.lang.String deviceName,
                       java.lang.String propertyName)
        A convenience method to get the Property of a Device by specifiying their names.
        Parameters:
        deviceName - the name of the Device.
        propertyName - the name of the Property.
        Returns:
        the Property with propertyName as name of the device with deviceName as name.

      • getElement

        public INDIElement getElement(java.lang.String deviceName,
                     java.lang.String propertyName,
                     java.lang.String elementName)
        A convenience method to get the Element of a Property of a Device by specifiying their names.
        Parameters:
        deviceName - the name of the Property.
        propertyName - the name of the Element.
        elementName - the name of the Element.
        Returns:
        the Element with a elementName as a name of a Property with propertyName as name of the device with deviceName as name.
